intro: Osbeckia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically features slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the western United States. Osbeckia pulchella is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments.
